page.title: 06CUSTOMS
page.content: {CUSTOMS OF MOBBERLEY. } {OLD CUSTOMS.} Many old customs have died out and some are not now allowed by law i.e. Bull and Bear Baiting. Most of the traditions connected with Mobberley took place during Wakes Week in October. Such as Quoiting, Goose pulling, Duck hunting and Wrestling. Frummerty (a special porridge) was eaten at this time. Wakes week is no longer celebrated, neither are - beating the bounds, rush bearing, bell ringing, marling and roping the Bride & Groom - holding a rope across the path of the Bride & Groom and exacting a toll before they could pass. {PARISH COUNCILS. Two burleymen have been appointed to Mobberley Parish Council for centuries and are still appointed to date. They assess damage done by farming stock.
